11#ifndef MODULES_AUDIO_CODING_NETEQ_STATISTICS_CALCULATOR_H_
12#define MODULES_AUDIO_CODING_NETEQ_STATISTICS_CALCULATOR_H_
13
14#include <deque>
15#include <string>
16
17#include "api/neteq/neteq.h"
18#include "rtc_base/constructor_magic.h"
19
20namespace webrtc {
21
22class DelayManager;
23
24// This class handles various network statistics in NetEq.
25class StatisticsCalculator {
26 public:
27 StatisticsCalculator();
28
29 virtual ~StatisticsCalculator();
30
31 // Resets most of the counters.
32 void Reset();
33
34 // Resets the counters that are not handled by Reset().
35 void ResetMcu();
36
37 // Reports that |num_samples| samples were produced through expansion, and
38 // that the expansion produced other than just noise samples.
39 void ExpandedVoiceSamples(size_t num_samples, bool is_new_concealment_event);
40
41 // Reports that |num_samples| samples were produced through expansion, and
42 // that the expansion produced only noise samples.
43 void ExpandedNoiseSamples(size_t num_samples, bool is_new_concealment_event);
44
45 // Corrects the statistics for number of samples produced through non-noise
46 // expansion by adding |num_samples| (negative or positive) to the current
47 // value. The result is capped to zero to avoid negative values.
48 void ExpandedVoiceSamplesCorrection(int num_samples);
49
50 // Same as ExpandedVoiceSamplesCorrection but for noise samples.
51 void ExpandedNoiseSamplesCorrection(int num_samples);
52
53 void DecodedOutputPlayed();
54
55 // Mark end of expand event; triggers some stats to be reported.
56 void EndExpandEvent(int fs_hz);
57
58 // Reports that |num_samples| samples were produced through preemptive
59 // expansion.
60 void PreemptiveExpandedSamples(size_t num_samples);
61
62 // Reports that |num_samples| samples were removed through accelerate.
63 void AcceleratedSamples(size_t num_samples);
64
65 // Reports that |num_packets| packets were discarded.
66 virtual void PacketsDiscarded(size_t num_packets);
67
68 // Reports that |num_packets| secondary (FEC) packets were discarded.
69 virtual void SecondaryPacketsDiscarded(size_t num_packets);
70
71 // Reports that |num_packets| secondary (FEC) packets were received.
72 virtual void SecondaryPacketsReceived(size_t num_packets);
73
74 // Increases the report interval counter with |num_samples| at a sample rate
75 // of |fs_hz|. This is how the StatisticsCalculator gets notified that current
76 // time is increasing.
77 void IncreaseCounter(size_t num_samples, int fs_hz);
78
79 // Update jitter buffer delay counter.
80 void JitterBufferDelay(size_t num_samples,
81 uint64_t waiting_time_ms,
82 uint64_t target_delay_ms);
83
84 // Stores new packet waiting time in waiting time statistics.
85 void StoreWaitingTime(int waiting_time_ms);
86
87 // Reports that |num_samples| samples were decoded from secondary packets.
88 void SecondaryDecodedSamples(int num_samples);
89
90 // Reports that the packet buffer was flushed.
91 void FlushedPacketBuffer();
92
93 // Reports that the jitter buffer received a packet.
94 void ReceivedPacket();
95
96 // Reports that a received packet was delayed by |delay_ms| milliseconds.
97 virtual void RelativePacketArrivalDelay(size_t delay_ms);
98
99 // Logs a delayed packet outage event of |num_samples| expanded at a sample
100 // rate of |fs_hz|. A delayed packet outage event is defined as an expand
101 // period caused not by an actual packet loss, but by a delayed packet.
102 virtual void LogDelayedPacketOutageEvent(int num_samples, int fs_hz);
103
104 // Returns the current network statistics in |stats|. The number of samples
105 // per packet is |samples_per_packet|. The method does not populate
106 // |preferred_buffer_size_ms|, |jitter_peaks_found| or |clockdrift_ppm|; use
107 // the PopulateDelayManagerStats method for those.
108 void GetNetworkStatistics(size_t samples_per_packet,
109 NetEqNetworkStatistics* stats);
110
111 // Returns a copy of this class's lifetime statistics. These statistics are
112 // never reset.
113 NetEqLifetimeStatistics GetLifetimeStatistics() const;
114
115 NetEqOperationsAndState GetOperationsAndState() const;
116
117 private:
118 static const int kMaxReportPeriod = 60; // Seconds before auto-reset.
119 static const size_t kLenWaitingTimes = 100;
120
121 class PeriodicUmaLogger {
122 public:
123 PeriodicUmaLogger(const std::string& uma_name,
124 int report_interval_ms,
125 int max_value);
126 virtual ~PeriodicUmaLogger();
127 void AdvanceClock(int step_ms);
128
129 protected:
130 void LogToUma(int value) const;
131 virtual int Metric() const = 0;
132 virtual void Reset() = 0;
133
134 const std::string uma_name_;
135 const int report_interval_ms_;
136 const int max_value_;
137 int timer_ = 0;
138 };
139
140 class PeriodicUmaCount final : public PeriodicUmaLogger {
141 public:
142 PeriodicUmaCount(const std::string& uma_name,
143 int report_interval_ms,
144 int max_value);
145 ~PeriodicUmaCount() override;
146 void RegisterSample();
147
148 protected:
149 int Metric() const override;
150 void Reset() override;
151
152 private:
153 int counter_ = 0;
154 };
155
156 class PeriodicUmaAverage final : public PeriodicUmaLogger {
157 public:
158 PeriodicUmaAverage(const std::string& uma_name,
159 int report_interval_ms,
160 int max_value);
161 ~PeriodicUmaAverage() override;
162 void RegisterSample(int value);
163
164 protected:
165 int Metric() const override;
166 void Reset() override;
167
168 private:
169 double sum_ = 0.0;
170 int counter_ = 0;
171 };
172
173 // Corrects the concealed samples counter in lifetime_stats_. The value of
174 // num_samples_ is added directly to the stat if the correction is positive.
175 // If the correction is negative, it is cached and will be subtracted against
176 // future additions to the counter. This is meant to be called from
177 // Expanded{Voice,Noise}Samples{Correction}.
178 void ConcealedSamplesCorrection(int num_samples, bool is_voice);
179
180 // Calculates numerator / denominator, and returns the value in Q14.
181 static uint16_t CalculateQ14Ratio(size_t numerator, uint32_t denominator);
182
183 NetEqLifetimeStatistics lifetime_stats_;
184 NetEqOperationsAndState operations_and_state_;
185 size_t concealed_samples_correction_ = 0;
186 size_t silent_concealed_samples_correction_ = 0;
187 size_t preemptive_samples_;
188 size_t accelerate_samples_;
189 size_t expanded_speech_samples_;
190 size_t expanded_noise_samples_;
191 size_t concealed_samples_at_event_end_ = 0;
192 uint32_t timestamps_since_last_report_;
193 std::deque<int> waiting_times_;
194 uint32_t secondary_decoded_samples_;
195 size_t discarded_secondary_packets_;
196 PeriodicUmaCount delayed_packet_outage_counter_;
197 PeriodicUmaAverage excess_buffer_delay_;
198 PeriodicUmaCount buffer_full_counter_;
199 bool decoded_output_played_ = false;
200
201 RTC_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(StatisticsCalculator);
202};
203
204} // namespace webrtc
205#endif // MODULES_AUDIO_CODING_NETEQ_STATISTICS_CALCULATOR_H_
206
